title: EvolvableRNN
text: This project was made during my Master's thesis which evolved Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN) via an evolutionary algorithm called NeuroEvolution of Augmenting Topologies (NEAT).

title: PersonalWebsite
text: This repository contains the code of the website you're currently on. This website is my very first step in the world of front end developing.

title: RobotSimulator2D
text: A semi-completed project that paved the way for the EvolvableRNN project. Due to a change in focus in my Master's thesis, I abolished this project. However, it still contains some interesting code, which I left it on my GitHub.

title: TravelingSalesmanProblem
text: Implementation of a Genetic Algorithm in MatLab to propose solutions to various environments of the well-known Traveling Salesman Problem. This project was a school project.

title: TransferLearningKeras
text: A walk-through in Transfer Learning, using the Keras framework. This was one of my earlier ML projects, in which I introduced myself to the concepts of Transfer Learning, Keras, and Convolutional Neural Networks.

title: GifCreator
text: A short code snippet that creates GIFs by concatenating images using Python's Pillow library. I created this project to help with the visualisations of the TransferLearningKeras project.

title: Toledo Lecture Downloader
text: Downloading web-videos by intervening the HTTP calls.

title: ChessBot
text: This project will provide a Python bot that can play chess using pyautogui and cv2. The chessbot utilises the minimax-algorithm for its decision making. I created this project to brush up my Python skills during the summer vacation.

title: DroneSimulation-Part4
text: A simulation of a multiple drones which will fly in a three dimensional virtual testbed. The main object of the drones is to bring packages from one airport to another as fast as possible. There will be multiple airports in the virtual testbed and multiple drones flying from one airport to the other to deliver packages. This project was my Bachelor's thesis, which resulted in a perfect (20/20) score.

title: DroneSimulation-Part3
text: A simulation of a multiple drones which will fly in a three dimensional virtual testbed. The main object of the drones is to bring packages from one airport to another as fast as possible. This (intermediary) project will demonstrate a worst case example of the next project (DroneSimulation-Part4) of a series of projects.

title: DroneSimulation-Part2
text: A simulation of a drone which will fly in a three dimensional virtual testbed. An array of unit cubes will be loaded inside the virtual testbed, the main objective of the drone is to collect all cubes as fast as possible (no order specified). No difference in task compared to DroneSimulation-Part1, but a significant difference in implementation and performance.

title: DroneSimulation-Part1
text: A simulation of a drone which will fly in a three dimensional virtual testbed. An array of unit cubes will be loaded inside the virtual testbed, the main objective of the drone is to collect all cubes as fast as possible (no order specified).

title: Asteroids
text: This project is an own implementation of the game Asteroids. This project consists out of two game-modes: one where you have to fight enemies and one where you have to destroy all asteroids. This was my first Java project.
